comment.text: Went  here with another couple who this is the go to spot. The steaks are amazing and the large lobster was so tender for being a big crustacean. Service was so good and the desserts are super tasty.
Our family love New York Prime. We love the filet and crab cakes. The bar tenders are awesome!!!

photos.caption: Our family loves New York Prime!

comment.text: Absolutely incredible experience! I wish I had asked the waiter for his name (he of course said his name when we sat down but I quickly forgot) because his great service and knowledge definitely added to value of our overall experience. The food was fantastic, I am from NY and have dined at many steakhouses, New York Prime is by far the best food I've had at a steakhouse. Appetizers we had the Oysters Rockefeller, Jumbo Baked Shrimp, and crab cakes. All three were amazing! Entree we had the New York Strip 16oz and the Bone-In rib 22oz with a side of cheesy mash. Steaks were perfectly cooked and charred just the right amount. I will absolutely be back here on my next visit to Atlanta!

photos.caption: New York Strip - 16 Oz , Cheese Mashed Potatoes, b√©arnaise sauce
Oysters Rockefeller Crab Cake Baked Shrimp

comment.text: Went here for my birthday with my family and it was one of the best food experiences of my life. The ambiance of the restaurant was beautiful, and amusingly there were steam punk cosplayers from a local convention at the bar. We started off with the Oysters Rockefeller, which were just amazing. Personally, I liked it better than the baked shrimp but both were extremely fresh that I could still taste the saltwater.  I ordered the Petite Steak and it was one of the best steaks of my life; I ordered it medium-well and it was amazingly tender and well-seasoned. My mother ordered the crab cakes, she said it was good but she said it was a bit salty (take that with a grain of salt though :)). My father ordered the Sea Bass and said it was a tad bit dry but it was very good. For dessert we ordered the Butter Cake, which was huge but very delicious. I also got a complimentary desert for my birthday, which was very nice. The service was A+ and although I forgot the name of our server, he was very nice and we chatted about our college experiences. Overall, highly recommend and I don't regret spending my birthday dinner there!

photos.caption: Butter Cake, Fresh Baked Chocolate Chip Cookie

user.name: Brolin E.
user.address: Legacy At The River Line, Mableton, GA

comment.text:
My wife and I came here for Valentine's Day. It started off with good service, until our entree came. After we hade portioned the sides, I noticed there was a 'made in China' tag that had been deep fried into our brussel sprouts. The waiter never came over to check after the food was served, so I had to flag him down. He apologized and took them back to the kitchen. Meanwhile, we cut into the steak. We ordered medium and it came out raw. I knew it was raw, despite the darkness in the restaurant. I took my phone out and used the flash light. It was definitely raw. I had to flag him down again. They took the cut up $85 steak back and threw it back in the oven, brought it out, and didn't even come back to check if the temp was good. A manager never came out and apologized. I've never had an experience like this at a restaurant of this supposed caliber. It doesn't matter what grade of meat you have if you can't cook it. As we were leaving, I asked to speak with the manager. He had just walked up. He said he was sorry and that no one had alerted him. He gave me his card and said to call if we came back. I honestly, don't care to go back. We would've been better off going to Little Alley. At least the server and manager are present and ask if everything was good there.  I expected better customer service and food for the price point.

Additionally, the restaurant did not follow proper social distancing guidelines. The guy next to us (within 4 feet of our table) proceeded to pull his chair around to where he was within 2 feet of our table.

photos.caption: Raw $85 Steak that was supposed to be cooked to medium temperature.

comment.text: first time there and i must say the food was good.. customer service was very slow.. drinks was good.. beautiful decor.. they offer valet parking.. what i don't like is the fact u have to wait until your entire party has arrived... definitely will be return when it's less busy so i can have better customer service

It was ok. My bone in rib eye was ok in flavor and cooked to the perfect temp. My broccolini taste great but super hard.  My thick sizzling bacon was great. My oysters on a half shell were amazing. My lemon drop martini was not good at all i had to send it back. I got a cosmo instead it was better than the lemon drop but i wouldn't order it again.  Overall nice experience, nice ambiance but I will not return not because it's nasty only because I've had better.

This place is great! Had dinner here for our Anniversary Saturday on August 8, 2020 and the food was fantastic! We had Oyster Rockefeller and Shrimp Cocktail for appetizers. Main course I had SeaBass and my husband had Filet. For sides we had mash potatoes, cream corn, and garlic spinach. They gave us a free dessert for our anniversary. Large warm chocolate chip cookieI with vanilla ice cream. Yummy 
I also had a French Martini and it was delicious!
Everyone was friendly and our waiter was awesome! Definitely going back again, very nice restaurant.

Dining alone can be weird, however when I explained to John that I love a great steak he took care of everything for me. I had a bone in cut that was out of this world. 

The service was superb and upon finding out I was dining alone and complimenting the chef, he came out to my table to thank me for the accolades and asked if there was anything else he could do for me.

So glad I took a chance on this based upon reviews, must visit again when I am in Atlanta.

Sea Bass was as delish as they come!! Rockefellers were on point. Shrimp cocktail was delish...Big #10 shrimp, and they were cold and fresh. All the food came out lightning fast! The only bummer is the smoking inside the restaurant!! Other wise...5 stars here!! Cant wait till 1.1.2020...NO MAS SMOKING
A great steakhouse with a beautiful romantic ambience. Order all the sides they're delicious!

Oh man, I had a delicious meal tonight, I enjoyed the fresh oysters and crunchy cold shrimp for appetizer, and ordered Salmon with mushrooms main dish. I also tried little piece of the roasted chicken it was okay but I'm happy with what I ordered. 
Aren't you sure what to order? I would recommend you The Salmon with Mushrooms so tasty.

photos.caption: Fresh Oysters and Crunchy Cold Shrimp.

comment.text: I had to send my lamb chops back - overcooked. By the time I got it I was full from sides and just took it home. Not a penny comped. David our server was great. I was uneasy the whole night. No social distancing at all.  Most restaurants I go to have tables spread apart somewhat. NY Prime I guess takes profit over safety. People packed in like sardines. I have been a customer of the restaurant for 20 years. I expected more and after spending as much for a special birthday dinner. Won't be back. Very dissatisfied

Best steak I have eaten. For starters, seafood plate had lobster, crabs, shrimp and oysters. Good size for a group and very tasty. The lobster and shrimp bisque had hood amount of protein but salty. Filet cooked Pittsburgh style (little salt with butter cooked at 1700 degrees) was the best steak I ever had. Not too pretty on the outside at that heat but it was cooked perfectly and very juicy. All the side we're good, my favorite was the mushrooms. Service was great, attentive and prompt. Very classy with live music. Only downside was the people smoking cigars at the bar. This place became one of my favorites.

photos.caption: Center Cut Filet - 12 Oz . Barrel Cut

comment.text: I HIGHLY don't recommend this restaurant! They are very unprofessional. We book a reservation online for a party of 8 in advance 5 mins before our arrival time to the restaurant manager name Alex called us and said that he had to cancel our reservation because the restaurant is too full come back two hours I tried to explain to him that is extremely late and that it's super inconvenience because we have kids with us that is super hungry and he didn't care at all. I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Nahema, I'm sorry that you weren't able to join us. We're not very nimble in terms of reservation size, as your reservation was booked for a party of 2 with a note that you were a party of 9. We never want to turn guests away but if we do not have the availability for the a large group, we cannot accommodate. Alex did his best to seat you at a later time. In the future, since reservations for 8+ are not able to be made online, please call us for availability. Thank you for understanding, we wish you a happy holidays.

comment.text:
Upon arriving I wasn't sure we were in the right place because there were a lot of men standing around smoking cigars and drinking at the bar and I wasn't sure where to check in. 

Once we found the guy with the help of the valet gentleman he took us to our table. We made reservations online. This was our first time eating here we were celebrating our 9 year anniversary. 

I ordered a salad to start and we both ordered steaks with creamy spinach and southwestern corn. The steaks were absolutely amazing!!! They didn't require any sauce whatsoever. Since it was our anniversary they gave us a dessert on the house it was a warm chocolate chip cookie with ice cream. That was the best cookie I've ever eaten and I don't like chocolate. 

The only thing that I did not like about the restaurant was the smoking of the cigars. I don't like to be around smoke, I don't smoke. It was annoying to have to eat with the smell of smoke. It was worse that when I got home my clothes and hair smelled like it. I really really disliked that.

I went here for a friends birthday. I ordered the petite steak, medium well with a side of mushrooms. We waited almost 2 hours for our food!!! When the food arrived I received a well done NY prime steak.... I told the waiter that wasn't my steak but he insisted that was what I ordered. Smh not pleased at all!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Jennifer, We are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations and did not live up to our own high standards. There should have been no reason for the delay in receiving your meal. As for your incorrect steak temperature, we broiled all our steaks pittsburgh-style on a 1700 degree broiler that creates a charred outside, and as noted on our menu, we don't recommend cooking temperatures from medium well and above. That was likely the issue. Despite this recent experience, we know we can still wow you and hope you'll give us another chance.

comment.text: Beautiful restaurant and the food is amazing, customer service was excellent Emmanuel was great

Last weekend my girl and I were suppose to go to STK..but after hearing a few bad reviews and experiences we decided to go to NewYork Prime instead..best decision we could have made..very nice atmosphere,great service and the food was delicious..I definitely recommend for a nice little date night.

Our first visit, and we were worried about the reviews mentioning the smoke from the bar. No worries!! New Atlanta ordinance prevents smoking!!! The food was fabulous!! Crisp salads, juicy steaks with yummy crisp outside, generous sides (we had way too much!) and fabulous service. We will be back!!

Best steakhouse in Atlanta hands down.  Very quaint and OG steakhouse feel with impeccable service and standing steaks.  The only steaks I have had in Atlanta where you won't even come close to making at home.  Chicago prime beef!  Get the broiled shrimp and the mushroom side!

I would love to have dinner again here if the manager isn't a greeter at the door! He was rude and had a very harsh racial overtone from the point of entry and constantly threatened to give away our table at every few minutes. We were waiting on family members to arrive from out of town and they were trying to navigate the parking and the parking deck and it infuriated  the manager! 
However, once you're beyond that point, the dinner was amazing! The waiter was on point! The atmosphere was awesome. 
Would have given a five star if not for the racial overtone!

We went there this past Saturday and was very disappointed with the service that we received. First off we had a 7:15 pm reservation for 4. We arrived 10 mins before the order 2 in our party. They said it's fine your table isn't ready anyway we will text you.  We go to the bar and our friends arrive. Mind you they gave the reservation name as well when they got there.  We are sitting at the bar for well over an hour and we go ask what was going on and the manager says, "oh we've been seating others before you because we didn't think your party was here yet." Did you not think to text us?? Since clearly that's what you said that you would do!!  Once we finally got seated the server comes over and is reaching all over us instead of walking around the table. Food finally comes out after forever and it's cold. You could clearly tell it had been sitting.  We mentioned when making the reservation that we were celebrating birthdays. That wasn't acknowledged but they made a big deal out of several birthdays around us.  This place is too expensive to give this type of service.  I won't be back!

The restaurant has a very upscale yet welcoming vibe. The entrees are separate from the sides however you can order the sides in family portions. You do get a hearty amount on your plate for the price. The lump crab appetizer was unbelievably fresh. And the lump crab were actually lumps and not just small pieces . Well worth it. We went on a Saturday at 7:30 with a party of 8. We sat immediately  upon our walk in. We were celebrating a birthday locally however my party and I had a room at the W so our hotel service had a private car take us to the restaurant . The restaurant does however have valet service. Fun fact they do have a cigar menu within their drink menu. The live music, atmosphere and ambience was great. I will say it was  a little dark in the restaurant some of my party who wore glasses did use their phone light to read the menu. However the restaurant was overall a great experience. I will come back on a more intimate occasion, like a date or with a smaller party .

My guy and I flew to Atlanta for Valentines Day weekend and we had dinner here. I must admit that I was a little displeased with being sat outside, because it wasn't aesthetically pleasing for an upscale dining experience, BUT we were greeted by  our server, Nettie and she was AWESOME. Her southern accent and superb service set the tone for a wonderful evening. She explained in detail the menu and even suggested the most popular appetizers and we were not disappointed. Everything we ate was so fresh and delicious. We have been to several steakhouses, but none compared to the food at NY Prime. We were so impressed by the service and quality of food,that we rated it as #1 on our list of restaurants. We will definitely be making another trip to Atlanta to have dinner here again and we will make sure to request Nettie as our server. WONDERFUL DINING EXPERIENCE!!!!

This used to be my favorite steak house. It is unfortunate to have to give this review. The service and quality of food has certainly changed. We got there early before the normal rush, but this did not help the attentiveness of the server.  After a long wait at the table, our server finally came to greet us. It took a while but he eventually returned with our drinks and took our order.  The food quality was sub par compared to how I remember it before COVID. Prices were higher but I anticipated this due to current supply. I didn't anticipate the service to suffer. We did not see our server for the majority of the meal and when we did, we had to ask for our empty drinks to be replenished.  When it came time for the check, a dessert menu was not offered so we went ahead and accepted the check. We promptly gave our credit card and it wasn't for another 20 minutes (at the least) that our server returned with the receipt.  Based on this, My view of this restaurant has not made it high on my list to return.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Shannon, Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. We obviously fell short in many ways during your last experience and I'm truly sorry for that. I'd love an opportunity to remain as your favorite steakhouse. Please email at edinino@newyorkprime.rest¬†so that I may setup your next reservation. I will personally concierge your next visit to make sure it is what you and I expect from New York Prime. Looking forward to meeting you. Happy Holidays, Ennio Di Nino, Operating Partner

comment.text: request Steven! i promise you won't be disappointed ! he's the best waiter ever, gives the best recommendations and always knows how to impress. second time having him as our waiter and i must say he makes the whole new york prime experience one to remember. thanks Steven for another memorable dining experience

My husband and I dined at New York Prime for the first time last night. Choosing New York Prime as the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. It was truly a grand experience. The service was extremely exceptional, and attentive but we never felt rushed. I started with the Frosty Lemon Martini, their version of a lemon drop (I loved it). The hubby had the Johnny Walker Black straight up (he's a scotch man). I think they were being really nice because it was our anniversary because they gave him a full short ball of JWB. That's unheard of for 14 bucks. I love oysters, so of course we started with the Oysters Rockefeller. I've had better oysters but they were good. For my dinner I chose the bone-in ribeye, and hubby got the New York Strip. They pride themselves on being masters of charring, and they are. The steaks were beautifully charred, and my ribeyes flavor was excellent. The sides are shareable, and we chose the creamed spinach, and Southwest creamed corn. Again, everything was excellent. New York Prime is my new favorite steakhouse.

The food and service was very good. Our waiter Kyle was outstanding. My only complaint is the music. We had to listen to 70's rock the entire meal, and it was to loud. It was hard to have a conversation at our table of four. I think some smooth jazz in the background would be a better choice.

This is the second or third time i /we have reviewed NY Prime. It is with pleasure that we say, run, do not walk to this fine restaurant! We had dinner there recently and as always from the minute we entered the room until we paid the bill, it was sensational! Great drinks, steaks that are the best in Boca Raton, and service always fabulous. 
 Just want everyone to know, that NY Prime is in it's prime as the best steakhouse in Boca, and quite possibly the best restaurant as well!
 Bravo NY Prime!

So I really had high hopes for this restaurant since I waited so long to dine here, but honestly it was OK for a steakhouse. If you are not familiar with the location, it's tucked away and difficult to find. 

I went on Valentines Day and was pleasantly surprised that we did not wait to be seated. The service was impeccable.

What I didn't like was the choice of sides and appetizers. They did not serve the traditional seafood or truffle Mac & Cheese. Or any Mac & cheese for that matter. No potato Au Gratin. No crab cakes for an appetizer. The side I ordered was loaded baked potato and my man ordered French fries. Really, French fries with a $40 steak? So although the steak was good, I didn't enjoy the entire entree due to the selection of sides.

Nice steakhouse but will probably not return.

New York Prime has two dishes on the Atlanta Convention and Visitor's Bureau Signature 100 list: The 14 oz filet and the banana cream pie. 

They no longer have a 14 oz, so I got the 12 oz. It was literally the best steak I've ever had. Got it medium rare. I might have seen jesus with every bite. The banana cream pie was also delicious, but can you really go wrong with that?

The only reason I am four starring this place over five starring is that it's so damn smoky!! I felt like I was eating in a cigar lounge or something.
I've worked at New York and Dined there.  Best steak I've ever had was there.  The place is top notch. I highly recommend it. It's as good as it gets.

Bartender was awesome, but things went downhill when we got to the table. Our server was blah and slow. Had to ask for bread, left us parched and just unenthusiastic overall. The food had highs and lows. The fried lobster was so so bad. Breading tasted like chicken nugget batter from school lunch and the lobster itself had NO taste. Baked shrimp appetizer wasn't too bad, but someone in my party said it tasted like pool water. Oyster Rockefeller not bad either, but the spinach tasted like frozen spinach and not fresh spinach and the presentation on the rock salt was not a great choice at all. Crab cakes were impressive (all crab meat with no filling), but lacked soul. Sea bass, I was told is the best sea bass in the city! Can't go wrong with that, but don't get it with Brussels. They don't take the end off the Brussels sprouts, leaving them very chewy. Nothing special about those, but the other sides were good. Steak was superb and cooked to perfection. Oh! The bisque was amazing! But the soup being at the top of the list doesn't say much for the restaurant. I probably won't be back. So many restaurants in Atlanta that are so so good this one I may not repeat.

(4) ~ very good overall food & service.


DRINKS:
** Yuengling Lager (bottle) = (4) very good
** Espresso = (4) very good

FOOD:
** Thick Bacon = (4.75) Great!  Best Thick Bacon I've ever had!  Especially with the Brooklyn French Dressing, which can be described as a cocktail sauce blended with some French Salad dressing.
** Bread Bowl & Butter (free) = (4.25) Very good, especially the crisps;)
** White Chocolate Banana Pudding = (4.25) Very good
* Filet Mignon (petite) = (3.75) Good
* Lyonnaise Potatoes (Hash browns + Onions) = (3.75) Good, especially when you add ketchup;)

Best meal and service I've ever had!!!  I had the salmon.  It comes with mushrooms on top.  The salmon was perfectly cooked but I must say the mushrooms were my favorite part.  Only thing I'll warn about is their family style sides.  We didn't care because we like taking a doggie bag.  We were celebrating my dads birthday and they gave him a complimentary chocolate chip cookie and ice cream.  Softest cookie ever!  This is my new go to restaurant.

We basically waited a total of 2 hours for our food. When we were waiting our waiter megan did not check up on us once or at least said  "sorry for the wait, is there anything that you guys need? " Our waters were refilled once while eating our meal. Eating at a high end restaurant like this, we as customers expect decent service. The steak was salty, but was overall pretty good. The mushrooms were great, but the corn was not. It was basically sweet canned corn topped with some cheap taco seasoning. Was it good? It was okay. Was it worth $110? No. Would I come again. No.

Celebrated by husbands birthday here just the two of us and it was epic!!! It was the most peaceful laid back atmosphere, while maintaining its elegance. I love being able to enjoy my meal without having to ask the waiter for refills or napkins and it was more than pleasing our server went above and beyond ensuring our satisfaction."Richard". Due to the previous reviews I was skeptical of this place but those people weren't even close to describing the restaurant and I'm so happy I went with my instincts and decided to ck.e anyways.

First time going was on Saturday and I will definitely be back. I absolutely loves the ambiance. While it was busy it didn't feel that way. The waiter's service was superb. The food was even better. Had enough for lunch the next day.
Great atmosphere. They cook their steaks Pittsburgh style which my favorite. Had a phenomenal waiter, Leo. Will definitely be back soon.
I enjoyed the center cut ribeye and creamed spinach. The steak was cooked perfectly. You can taste the hint of nutmeg in the creamed spinach. This was a great Christmas gift.

Barrel Cut Filet or Porterhouse is out of this world.... Seafood appetizer tray was absolutely awesome!

5 stars all the way

Great food and excellent service. We went here for NYE dinner. It's a quaint spot located directly across from Lennox Square Mall in a high rise. Found free parking in a parking deck located adjacent to the building the restaurant is located in, so that was a plus. Have to knock it a star for the same reason as all the other reviews: the smoke. It being a small little place, they allow for cigar smoking and if just one patron is partaking, then you're inhaling. It was over-bearing and made my wife a little ill. I'm not sure why in this day in age a restaurant still allows for smoking, but Prime does, so be prepared!

This place is your solid awesome steak house. Great drinks great wine menu and amazing food. To start the table bread was good. Would of been great if the bread was warm. Ceasar salad was great. Had the bone in filet and it was cooked to perfection. The onion straws were also really tasty. Wife had the cheesy mash potatoes and again very good. And finally the dessert. Had the huge Chocolate tower with ice cream and 4 people ate from this dish but was really good. The service here is amazing and I will definitely return. The only reason I am giving it a 4 start is because this place allows smoking inside the restaurant. So at our table we could smell to much smoke which made my wife a little nausea. 
I will be back to this restaurant.

Pay attention to the description. I ordered the lamb thinking most fine dining have the rack of lamb...wrong. They were very meaty but the lamb chop is a tougher meat. I ordered medium well. It was very charred (almost burnt) with rare inside. The baked potato had an odd taste to it. Creamed spinach was not good. Won't be back. 

It was to go and the waiter was very pleasant.

We had a reservation and we were refused at the door because my wife had a pair of $400 jeans that had a tiny hole in them. I get the dress code but we dress pretty conservative and we walked into the palm down the street and they had no problem at all. A man got seated right after they refused us that had on sloppy shorts and tennis shoes. The gentleman at the reception that refused us was a jerk on top of everything else. He acted like she had a bikini on. Never ate there before and they won't get my money ever now. Spent that $300 on dinner and drinks at the palm. Great meal at the palm

Would have given a 5 star, but they allow smoking at the bar and it you are sensitive to smoking, that effects the whole  atmosphere. One of the Manager said around September the City of Atlanta enforces the new smoking laws. The steak was excellent.  Also the sides are a la carte.  No a bad place to eat but won't be returning until the new smoking bans is law.
Amazing steaks and wine selection. We always have a great time. Butter cake for desert is to die for
Great service. Great food. Sophisticated atmosphere. Sexy. Cigars. Steven the bartender is awesome. Had my birthday dinner here. Happy I did.

Had an amazing experience at NY Prime at a family dinner. The atmosphere is excellent and exactly what you would expect at a top tier restaurant. The service was on point and even with our large party not a single glass went empty. The rest of Atlanta wishes they had this caliber wait staff. They were efficient and not obtrusive so we could talk and not be constantly interrupted like other places and every item came out exactly as requested. Then the meal...every item looked Instagram perfect when it appeared and was cooked spectacularly. I highly recommend their Old Fashioned from the cocktail menu and have now been ruined for life and will have to come back often.
